data.title: Great Value Great Food
data.text:
Arrived at this Village Inn location and was taken to our table pretty much immediately upon arrival.  The Hostess asked us if we would like anything to drink and told us our waitresses name and then came back quickly.  Our Waitress came pretty quickly after that and asked us if we were ready to order, which we weren't but I had to tell her that the hostess already took our drink order.  The waitress returned a few minutes later and took our order; Instead of my soup coming before my meal arrived everything came all at once, the waitress indicated to me that the meal was ready before she had time to make the soup (funny; like she is actually back there making my soup).  
The food was hot and delicious and we sure received a lot of food for the money.
Our waitress come-by often to ask how our meal was going and of course we said "Great".
By the way I ordered their Chicken Fried Steak and it comes with your choice of sides and soup or salad.  They have several side dishes to choose from and about 2-4 choices for soups.

data.title: It just came together
data.text:
Today was a good day for a late breakfast.  The timing was perfect, we were in between crowds and no little kids around us.  It gets better.
Our server was a charming young lady who actually thought that the customers were to be treated like she would want to be and she excelled at it.  Her name is Gabby.
I had my standard, Ultimate breakfast and the wife had the VIB. I told Gabby that in another of the Village stores there had been a problem getting the food to us hot and the cook acted like he was paying for the potatoes by looking at the miserly portions.  She told me that would not happen and Gabby does not lie.  It came out hot, fresh and tasty.  
I did have to ask the manager to turn the background music into background music.  I have hearing aids and loud music really fouls it up.  He moved on it right away and got the volume just right.  
I have to tell you this place was run right and it all started with Gabby.  The worst thing about it is it is not on my travel route so it is awkward to get to.  
I would go there again and the only problem is that once you are on top of the mountain you have to fight to stay there.  Keep up the good work because I write my reviews as I see them.  But for today, thank you, dj

data.title: Ok if you like a Denny's type restaurant
data.text: Decor and food offering/prices were like a Denny's or Bob evans.   Soup was homemade ( tomato basil) and was very good.  Sandwiches ok .... Pies looked homemade but couldn't tell.

data.title: been There, Done That
data.text:
Waitress & mgr very friendly. Service very good. I asked for a wet rag to clean the table, & waitress brought me one, in which I cleaned our table. Dinner time and only about 10-12 customers in the place = tells you something! Food avg, price a bit high for what we got. 
free pie on Wednesday is great but we did not go back during our 5 day stay.

data.title: Quick! Call the Board of Health!
data.text: Watched as a table was wiped down by the waitress with a filthy rag.  We were seated at this table that had food on the benches and food residue on the table.  The menu for deserts was dusty.  The restrooms were a total pig sty.  I ate 2 bites of what appeared to be an adequate eggs Benedict and watched as the bus boy took even a dirtier rag and wiped food onto the chairs around the table and leave.  Employee training in cleanliness is desperately needed.  We then left.  Wondering what the kitchen looked like where food is being prepared if this is how it is kept where the public is watching.

data.title: Basic
data.text: I go to village inn alot because it's close and convenient. The eggs often look foreign but the food is cheap and ok.

data.title: Horrible
data.text: We're not picky people, but the service was terrible and the food was worse. This place even messed up my kids mac and cheese. Very disappointed.
